title: FIB: Implement Preorder@Cloud Interface
description:
Description
Prerequisites for this epic: 
Locations are added to FIB (manual and excel upload) 
German Locations are enhanced with a KLS ID
  Implement API To Preorder@Cloud, TMF 645
When adding a new location (manually or via upload) the availability check via Preorder@cloud is automatically send 
Data to be shown from the request within FIB:
FTTH Status
Additional information will be requested in Q2
Additionally there will be a button "Request FTTH Availability". Via this button the user has the possibility to request an availability update for choosen (dedicated) locations.
Thirdly a request will be sent to Preorder@Cloud automatically after getting a change event from TechPOM (see below)
User Workflow:
The user adds locations to the FIB Tool either by Excel upload or by manual adding
When the locations are saved and the KLS ID is added, the request to Preorder@Cloud is done 
If a location has been added manually, no waiting hint is shown, but the anwser should be there really fast
If locations are added by Excelupload a hint is shown that the FTTH data is being fetched
The user can update the screen 
When all FTTH data is in place, the user filters for the locations in state "notplanned" and "areaplanned" 
The user ticks in the locations in that state and chooses (via button "Request Availability") "Send Interests to Interest DB" 
In case the locations have a wrong state or mandatory data is missing, a hint is shown so that the user can rework the locations that are "wrong"
A popup opens in which the user needs to confirm the interest of the customer 
The request is sent to TechPOM
TechPOM replys with ok and unique ID per location, those information are added to DB and FE table
When the FTTH state of a location is changing to VVMongoing, a request is going out to Preorder@Cloud to update the FTTH information for the location 
--> blue are new FE Requirements that are integrated in FIGMA
 
 
    DOR Status Comment
Acceptance criteria are defined.    
The Epics is approved by system architects (done on Epic level). The appoval was done in develpoment circles with subject matter experts    
The Epics is prioritized within the backlog (WSJF Method)    
The Epics are understood by Dev Teams and estimated     
The Epics are documented within JIRA    
Dependencies are identified and there are no external dependencies that can´t be solved within the ART    
Non-functional requirements (NFR) are identified.    
Security and privacy approval required User Stories are labelled as those. Primary in the acording Jira Parameter     
Initial high-level acceptance test cases written and reviewed by PO test cases we aggreed later on    
All the information relevant to development is linked: other stories, relevant designs, confluence sources of information, other specs    
GUI Views have been defined (in form of click-dummy) and discussed with users for implementation    
Process dependency / adaptations has been defined    

Business Scope:
As a user of the FIB tool I want to be able to request availability on different technical plattforms and see the result in the tool to use it for my quotes.
acceptance_criteria: Interface to Preorder@Cloud is implemented and automatically triggered upon creating a location with KLS ID
Automatic update of the FTTH states and columns when respective event is received from TechPOM
The field FTTH Status is filled/updated by the interface for the time being
For operational use, approximately 50,000 address queries per day are expected.
Responding to queries by the next business day is sufficient, meaning all requests can be received and answered during off-peak hours.
Additionally, the NFR (Non-Functional Requirements) of TMF-645 should apply.
